lexUnit.name: vibrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move with small movements rapidly to and fro.

sentence.text: From one of the other rooms came the harsh sounds of Guns'N'Roses , the heavy guitar making the walls vibrate .
The staircase walls seemed to vibrate with the sound of it .
These levels vibrate at different frequencies .
We might say we perceive them as separate because they vibrate at different frequencies .
The thunder thumped from some nearer point , the glass vibrated in the window , and Cameron came out of his doze to find Menzies grinning quizzically at him and offering him some more claret .
Literally everything in the room starts vibrating to the beat of the bass drum .
Penry stared at her incredulously , then to her relief the tension drained from his face before her eyes as his muscular , beautiful torso began to vibrate with laughter .
When we listen to music , for example , our eardrums vibrate with the rhythm of changing air pressure .
He walked across the floor and , although he caused little sound , the whole room vibrated with his weight .
He squatted down , his clothes vibrating against his body , and injected something into Ari 's neck .
The great compound curves which swept out from the guard vibrated under his hand , and the bowstring produced a low musical sound .
By impacting with neighbouring particles they vibrate about a locus , and only appear to remain in a fixed position .
At any temperature , a real crystalline solid is in a state of dynamic unrest , with the various electrons and atoms in its lattice vibrating about their mean positions .
John felt the hull of the yacht vibrating as the tanker approached .
In fact the atoms in diamond can vibrate at about 40 x 10 Hz .
The light , strongly-bonded carbon atoms can vibrate at unusually high frequencies , so the frequency of the radiation absorbed is very much higher for diamond than for other materials .
The roof is vibrating .
Here are some sentences in which two consonant sounds are identical to look at but sound slightly different because one is voiced ( the vocal cords vibrate ) and the other is unvoiced .
The floor of the cockpit was vibrating , the motors were screaming .
The frame of the bunk vibrated .
